ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about reading, writing, and speaking in french!! SO much french!!

I was able to speak French way better than I was at the beginning of the year by using more grammatical tools and vocabulary. I found it much easier this term to express my ideas and opinions on the any topic we engaged with. I also found it much easier to read the literature and texts that we were presented with in the class.
I really strengthened my grammatical skills when speaking in a way that ultimately became so comfortable I no longer had to focus on actively using proper grammar because it became second-nature.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There is a lot of work and less check-ins from professors (compared to lower levels of French) so definitely need a higher level of personal accountability!

I honestly found not weaknesses in the course. I could quite literally write novels on how amazing the instruction was by Madame Skorupa was. Although French is a lot of work and at least 2 -3 hours of work each night, it didn't feel like at work at all because Madame Skorupa did such an AMAZING job in teaching me. She also made it fun as much as it was academically rigorous. I actually think the content I remembered the most was because she was so animated or sung or brought a prop to class. She is quite truly a gem.
I really love the structure of this course, especially in learning specific parts of the language through other forms of media such as books, films, and music.

strengths -- very kind professor and helpful
weaknesses -- time allocation on certain things meant less preparation for exams

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I love the discussion of this course, but it is a lot of reading.
YES YES a thousand times yes. The language courses at Yale are phenomenal and particularly with Madame Skorupa.
I would recommend this course to students who are passionate about francophone arts and culture. Theres a heavy workload, but its often enjoyable if you are a lover of literature/film/music.
only if you care a lot about getting better at french
